reviews.review_msg: If she spends a lot of time on something, it doesn't mean that it is necessarily important. Correct terminology is very important for the lecture exams. Lab exam is hard but doable if you start prep on time (I didn't). No point in buying the textbook. Going to lectures doesn't help much, but she has in-class quizzes that are worth 5%.

Her labs were fun and her lectures were interactive which made it easier to follow along with topics. Definitely cares about het students and also got us all Tim bits one class. The midterm covers the first 1/2 of the course and the final covers the 1/2 half of the course, but the midterm was way easier than the final so don't be fooled.

Dr. Mladenovic was one of the first profs I had at SFU, and she was honestly really great. She is extremely caring and always did her very best to engage us in the material she was teaching, even buying the entire class of 200 donuts on one occasion. She is very sweet and the lectures/exams were fair, but you definitely need to study hard.

Dr. M is very accommodating. We had a TA strike so she made the midterm open book and MC. However, she is a very tough grader and expects us to use correct and precise key words otherwise we don't get marks for the question. This makes it harder to do well on short answer questions in her exams... I believe the course was scaled though
Would not recommend, the lab exam was brutal. Boring lectures as well, slides also horrible.

Dr. M is open minded and great at explaining the course concepts. Attending tutorials counts towards your grade and are recommended since some of the content on the exams may be from tutorial material. Dr M and her TAs are very explicit about what may or may not be on the tests. Very approachable and grades fairly. Make in depth notes on lectures!

i took BISC 101 and 102 with her. i don't really have any complaints. i found 101 a lot easier because 102 is more conceptual, but they are both doable. she seems to really care about how well of a job she is doing, and is really conscious of how students feel about the lectures. no complaints.
Horrible teacher and tough marker. GPA dropper for sure. Regret taking this class with her. Take it with someone else!

the class was manageable, all material on tests is on slides, so know the slides inside out. My strategy was to make flashcards on all the slides and that was how I studied. He is definitely passionate about the topics and can explain them well in my opinion. He adds in interesting current biology topics like CRISPR and 3 parent families too.
GUYS HE IS AWSOME BELIEVE ME IF U GET A CHANCE TAKE IT WITH HIM!! his goal is not to fail u just memorize his lectures and u will be fine

I LOVE TONY I DON'T UNDERstand why everyone is so stressed by him HONESTLY study the lectures and you will do just fine cuz all of his exams are from his lectures also he is so caring and always ready to answer questions in details and HE IS FUNNY. I dont know what yall want but he is a 1000/10 to me

Professor Williams is well-known as a first year gate keeper. Doing well in his class requires you to practically memorize his lecture. Nothing else is needed to get an A. 

Memorize the EXACT wording of his lectures, especially coloured key words. He WILL ask you and the EXACT copied wording from his slides will be required to get full marks.

He takes the time to put the essential information for students on his power points and presents them in an organized manner that will help students succeed. The course is fairly easy with the exception of the labs.
